lead_paragraph: The America’s Cup showdown between the two-time defending champion Alinghi of Switzerland and BMW Oracle Racing of the United States cannot begin for at least 10 months. New York State Supreme Court Judge Herman Cahn said it would be “inequitable” to deprive Alinghi of the full 10-month notice of challenge to prepare its boat. That 10-month period began with Monday’s ruling. BMW Oracle Racing had argued that it had the right as Challenger of Record to hold the best-of-three series in October, but Alinghi argued it would not be able to build a boat in time.
